title: Why are people still talking about Kindred as it is one champion
body:
I mean that the concept about Kindred is that they are two champion in one. This is way i love them as a champion(I am a big fen of the cool concepts). I had awlyas called them "they" but everyone is saying "she". I know it looks like the Labm is the main but please respect the concept. 
Thank you for reading this. If you have any reasons why Kindred is "she" the tell me.

replies.body: Yes, the _concept_ of the Kindred suggests that we should use they/them, but the gameplay suggests she/her. In my opinion, Riot didn't deliver very well on the Kindred's concept in game. I wish they would have done a toggle system to switch between Lamb and Wolf or that Wolf was more involved with the attacks and movements of the champion. It was really a missed opportunity to make a very unique champion design.

Pretty much yeh. I think Riot fails a bit on champion theme delivery. What is Yorick without the Myst Maiden or his corpses? Yet, his corpses are a bit too situational, so how does a Yorick fights anywhere else besides lanes when you don't have ultimate? Like a Nasus, bashing Q. Boring imo.

Skaarl could also feel more of a character if we could play him. Imagine that when Kled lost the first portion of HP he would fall on the ground and be stunned indefinitely, meanwhile we would play as Skaarl instead, on a mission to wake Kled. (Like a Jak and Daxter duo kinda thing).

Also, a bit more detail reinforces duo champions idea. In DotA 2 there's Ogre Magi who is a 2 headed Ogre, in the minimap it shows 2 faces side by side.

In the minimap what do we see? Lamb face, not Wolf. Aren't they 2 parts of a whole champion?

? Kindred's icon is KINDRED. It's both lamb and wolf.
{{champion:203}}
hm k, legit. But it just shows who's more dominant xD, I saw lamb, the white takes more of the mask, not saying it should be 50% but... ye.

It's mutual to refer to them as she because in the design, the champion really is Lamb for the most part. Wolf is just a thematic addition and takes a role in 2 abilities, one of them somewhat unnoticed because of the fast animation. (E)
I think Kindred could use a Shyvana level rework in order to make them just right.

It is also quite hard to notice that he is the one who hunts jungle camps, while Lamb looks for champions. >>

Due to how small the icon is, both champ select, in-game map, etc. It looks like the face of Lamb with some sunlight on the mask (the Wolf side). Hence why people often times people refer to them as "she".

It's mostly due to the fact that you're controlling Lamb while Wolf is merely just particles effects. Yes, Kindred should be referred to as, "they", but because most casual players see Lamb as the primarily role when playing, they often refer to them as "she". I've been guilty of this myself. 

It also doesn't help that each splash art, especially loading slice, tend to focus solely on Lamb too. Or the majority of the player base don't read the lore and have no idea their name are two champs in one.

Wolf is just secondary. It's almost a like a Talking Pix. Wait... he is present on only one spell (W) and talks... He's a Talking Pix. 
{{champion:117}} "Dust them Pix!"
Actually he is also present in the passive(the jungle mobs are marked by him) and the E(the last shot fires wolf)
Pix is present on Lulu passive too and her Q if you think about it. And in a more glittering way... That's exactly my point. He's a Talking Pix.
It's because though they're technically a they, you play as lamb, so most people just use she/her

While i love kindred and i get it by calling them "them"  but wolf is just like a add on and i love the lore and the ideal but honestly like many i agree it was a missed chance to do something great i mean i would have done something like this to make wolf really a big issue since the lore states lamb gives mercy to those would accept their fate and wolf takes those that run.

they need to do enough damage to "consider" the fact that they are not accepting fate and then the ult makes wolf the main with different skills for a short time kinda like how shyvanna changes. This would have been the way to go to me or to have no ult like jayce and change from lamb to wolf as needed and give different skills.
make wolf auto attack and i will call them they
